subject: Philosophy
title: The Dichotomy of Control
description: A fast breakdown of The Dichotomy of Control for builders.

hook.text: You can't control the weather, other people, or the economy. So why do they ruin your day?

buildup.text: Epictetus drew a sharp line: some things are up to us, and some things are not.

discovery.text: Your judgments, desires, and actions are yours. Everything else â€” health, reputation, wealth â€” is not.

twist.text: Most suffering comes from trying to control what's outside your power.

climax.text: Focus only on what you can influence, and peace follows. This is the bedrock of Stoic life.

punchline.text: Control your mind. Release everything else.

quiz.question: What is the Stoic dichotomy of control?
options: Some things are up to us and some are not
